intro: Mentha grisella subsp. syriaca, commonly known as the Syrian mint, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Syria and Turkey. It is characterized by its aromatic, square stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a grayish-white pubescence. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers in whorled clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its medicinal properties and aromatic qualities, it is valued in traditional herbal remedies and essential oil production.
